intro: Desmopsis talamancana, commonly known as the Talamancan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as figs and ceiba. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
